description.narrative: Sida och EBRD fond för kommunal miljöinfrastruktur. Syftar till att minska miljöföroreningar och bättre nyttjande av naturresurser, framförallt genom förberedande studier och stöd för att stärka partners kapacitet. Delsatsning inom "Miljömiljarden", som beslutades om år 2006.

Sida- EBRD Sustainable Municipal Technical Cooperation Fund. The objective is to decrease adverse environmental effects and improve management of natural resources, primarly through preparatory studies and capacity building support. The contribution is part of the "Environmental Billion", decided upon in 2006.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: This intervention concerns two different trust funds that were established at the Nordic Investment Bank (NIB) and European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) in 2006. A completion memo for the fund with NIB was completed in 2015, which means that this second and final completion memo only deals with the trust fund that was established at EBRD. The purpose of this trust fund was to finance technical cooperation activities in support of environment and energy efficiency projects in North West Russia. It was established in December 2006 and concluded in the end of 2018 Three projects and four separate assignments were financed from this trust fund during the implementation period, which included;* preparation of a feasibility study for a district heating project in Kaliningrad* monitoring of the implementation of the Kaliningrad water and wastewater project* assessment of energy savings in a district heating project in Vologda The annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation in 2014 led to a situation where EBRD was no longer allowed by its shareholders to inititiate new projects in Russia after mid 2014. This negatively affected the ability to make use of the financing made available in the trust fund. Therefore it was also not possible to finance the number of different assignments from this trust fund that were expected from the beginning. After 2014 no new assignments were financed from the fund, and after several years had passed without a change in the position of EBRD to finance new projects in Russia, it was finally decided by Sida to close this fund and to ask for a repayment of the unspent funds.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
